title: Welcome to my blog!
description: This is my first blog post. I created this to make sure I know how to make a blog post.
contents:
Motivation: one of my bad habits as a PhD student so far has been not
reading any papers, then whenever it’s time to work on something,
reading 100 abstracts at one time and only the papers that seem the most
important. I’ve decided to work on that by attempting to read a paper a
day. Every day when I come to the office, the first thing I will do is
read a paper.
I currently have a backlog of printed-out papers to read, so I’ll try
and get through those first unless something really catches my
attention. I’ll be as strict as I can, but some days I know I just won’t
have time (I run into a lot of time crunches recently…) and some days
I’ll probably read more than one paper. Maybe I’ll make two blog posts
on those days.
I read somewhere that one of the best ways to remember the take-home
points of a paper is to write down a summary with your thoughts
immediately after reading (and annotating!) the paper, so that was the
impetus for this blog.
Maybe at some point I’ll figure out how to set up comments on this
blog (I bet Alison Hill has a blog post about how to do it) but for now,
if you want to get in touch with me to tell me how much you love my blog
or that I completely misinterpreted your paper, go back to my main site and get
my contact info there.
